physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Dysmetria on the right side, slight wide-based gait, difficulty in tandem walking, decreased gag reflex on the left side, visual acuities 20/60 in the right eye and 20/40 in the left eye, bitemporal visual field defects worse inferiorly. No evidence of lymphadenopathy.
Marked improvement in vision: 20/25 in the right eye and 20/25 in the left eye, without corrective lenses.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Visual acuities improved from 20/60 and 20/40 preoperatively to 20/25 bilaterally postoperatively.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Visual acuities returned to 20/20 in each eye, with full visual fields.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Substantial improvement in swallowing and gait disturbances.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Return of some visual symptoms and difficulty swallowing. MR imaging showed interval progression of enhancing lesions especially in the posterior fossa.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progression of some symptoms after initially improving.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Resolution of enhancing lesions on MR imaging.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Complete resolution of symptoms after renewed corticosteroid therapy.
